reviews.review_msg: Mike's class was the last class I took before switching my major to economics. The focus on current events was helpful for working through what was happening at the time. The project was great, but picking good groupmembers was tough.

To be honest, nice teacher in class. His class is interesting, and he will answer your question very fast. But! textbook is useless and tons of very academic readings. Exam is hard because sometimes you have no idea where the questions come from. After his class, you would have no idea on how to study and review for exam

OK, He is nice guy as other said.he explain something and the exam come from somewhere (NOT from the book or his lecture) in other words, his lecture and the book are useless. in the exam less than 40 from lectures and book other 60% from somewhere else. he is very hard marker. the class is easy but the problem with him
Best professor I've had at SFU. He's funny, knowledgeable and despite what others are claiming, he has very reasonable exams.

one of the worst class I took ever, the class is easy but his exam way hard. he explain something in the class but the exam question came from somewhere I don't know from where.. if you want a good grade don't take his class.also, he is a hard marker

Very knowledgeable, not just about the course material but everything in general, making the lecture far more interesting. Rote studying for exams will NOT work, as questions refer to scenarios not explicitly described in lecture. As long as you understand the reasoning covered in class though, you'll do well. Wish he was teaching this summer...

He is irresponsible. He always uploads the notes late and does not use projector or ppt. However, his handwriting is horrible! He likes to run out of topic, and it's really hard to follow. Sometimes he does not even know the stuffs himself.

He is a very talent pro. He really loves talking and he talks fast... When you ask him a question he just keeps talkingggg and then you find out you cannot follow him any more. His brain runs fast.But he is very nice and friendly. :D Always willing to help.
took 102 was way too hard
useless textbook.boring lecture!(just copy your friend's notes)exams are straight off from the notes!lots to memorize. she's nice though

About 95% of the exam questions are straight from her notes. Just memorize them and you'll definitely get a good mark. This class is a GPA booster, but you probably won't learn anything new if that's what you're hoping to do.

Overall her exams are fair. But she tends to focus on what I think are unnecessary details. For example, she asks questions like what the author argues on page XX. And what are the arguments in a particular article. We have to know them out of the blue and I barely realize that's going to improve our economic skill. But overall she is good.

wow, i got a way higher mark in micro/macro economics than this course, even though this course has no econ prerequsites. shes makes such a simple course extreemly difficult, with boring long notes and articles. shes acyually discouraged me from studying econ. By far worst econ prof there is.
just plain awful. don't know how she's a prof, she cant teach at all. so much you need to know for exmas that are pretty hard. this is supposed to be a first year econ course. NOT A GPA BOOSTER

Cannot teach at all. Don't even bother to buy a book; her lectures are directly from the book, and all you do during the class is writing her notes, which she writes in class using an overhead. Class is extremelly borring; so if you are interested in Econ, do not take it with her. Her exams are not hard, but her marking system is totally unfair.

First of all she's not hot AT ALL, second shes goes way too fast when teaching that no one knows what is going on. her exams are brutal and the tutorials require you to make a couple presentations that are marked extrremly hard by the dull TA's. this is supposed to be an easy class so plz do yrself a favor and do not take it with her.

Suck teacher....she better to learn more about economic...she doesn't preparing any stuff for the class.... always did something wrong on the class....She is very sick of english skill...hard to understand...really don't know what she talking about on the midterm paper...try to avoid her if you guys can.....Really sucks.....

Try to avoid this class if you can. Although the workload is relatively light, earning high marks is quite hard. There are two assignments both of which the class average was around 60%. Full participation marks were hard to achieve Lectures are definitely rushed and the textbook is useless for exam review. Also 75 % is a C+.Dreading the final now.

She's not tech savvy in the least - her mic is practically off and whenever it is on, the Russian accent makes it tougher still. Despite that, she is an easy-going prof with tests based on her lectures. Attend class, take notes, and you'll do fine.
Good marker, knows her stuff. However, is very hard to hear and she doesn't really know how to help people...

Please ignore the negative comments below.  If you can't do well in this course you shouldn't be in uni. The exams are not bad but she is a very fair marker so that makes them a lot easier, and she marks assignments easy too.  She is very interested in the course material and encourages question, not to mention she has a great sense of humor.
All round great!

class is easy to follow, interesting and Vera is quite funny.  She is very accommodating with attendance issues and is a good marker - if she thinks you understand the material, and you show up and participate in tutorials, it will be reflected in your mark.  Would definitely take another class of hers.
Her strength is to fail more than half of the stduents in the final. I bet her to use the curve, but surprsingly she DOE NOT know what it is. As I know, the highest grade in this course was B-
Just one sentence: AVOID HER!!!!!!!!!!!!

she is the worst prof i ever met insfu so far. she is afraid of communicating with ta resulting in the incredibly huge mark gap between her tut and others. also, she is useless at all for learning economics and your grade. finally, she is always nervous on the lecture due to lacking the experiences.

Only good thing was light course(useless textbook used only for 1 simple Asmt) and easy marks for quizzes. Final exam avg was ~67%, and she was pretty helpful if you went to her office. Didn't like the way grades were given though(83-86: B+, 86-87: A-,86-94:A,94+: A+). Long answers on final were marked fairly, but lost 5 mks for every wrong T/F.

I took Econ102 with Vera last semester, I studied hard and I guess it was only the people who know a lot of Econ did well in the class. Even if I sit in the front roll, I cannot hear what the prof is talking about. The class average were basically a C+ to B range

Very horrible prof. avoid at all cost. I took this course with Econ105 & 103 knowledge and i ended with a C grade. I did 80% on midterm where the class avg was 60%. Final i thot wsa rly easy, but I guess I bombed it? since i got a C. Everyone bombed it so she said. She failed a bunch of ppl. You'd think no pro would fail half the class? thnk again.
you can get a lowest grade you've never seen.

Not an easy prof. Speaks with accent but understandable. MT was 25 MC @ 2.5pts and 5 SA @ 10pts, class avg was 60%. Final was 5 TF @ 5pts and 5 SA @ 10pts, not sure about class avg but many people bombed the final and many people failed the course and this is supposed to be a 100 course. Be careful when taking classes with this prof.
i found her very difficult to understand in class. She has a strong accent and speaks very quietly.
His exam was tough ngl, but he is a great prof
Very nice professor. Midterm and final was open book, open laptop. Course was pretty straight forward and no real trick questions. Overall a pretty solid experience.
Great prof but hard marker
he is my prof this summer, so far. he is very hard marker + not very clear. I don't recommand him at all
he is good prof but hard marker
he was my TA for ECON102. he is nice but very hard marking and the exam is hard. Also, he has alot of power over in the grade

Prof is decent. Course was a flop because it was 3 hours of lectures all at once. Lectures make you want to fall asleep, but the prof is passionate and knowledgeable. Just reread the slides and take good notes. You'll do fine. Also beware of iClicker.

Honestly a fair, nice guy, and takes time to answer questions and have class discussions. But, very difficult for an intro Econ course. Took me hours of work each week to keep up. Course slides are a little disorganized, but there is lots of info to cover. Lectures can be boring. One tip, make sure to know every concept and detail on the slides.

really long lectures but he is very passionate about what he teaches. read every single slide he posts and be sure to look over the previous tests to study. bring a coffee to the lectures and you'll be fine
Do not take this courses with this prof! lectures are extremely boring and exams are difficult. Exams is based off many things not mentioned in his slides.v

The lecture is very long and dry, and attendance is required as there will be tophot pop questions during classes. Material of this class is pretty interesting but the way he presented is somehow boring. He loves to ask about small details on the slides so be aware of that. Textbook is somehow useless as everything is covered during the lecture.

It's very possible to get a good grade by memorizing his numerous unorganized slides but it took a lot of time and stress and even then, his exams are unpredictable and focus too much on small details. Avoid this prof if you can.

The lectures are veryyyy dry but you are forced to show up with his tophat marks. The material is all over the place. Prof is definately passionate about the material but this course needs to be like 2 hours max a lecture 3 is overkill and boring! Exams were fair nothing too bad as long as you keep up with the material!
Lectures are so dry. I mean 3 hours go by veryyyy slow. I do not know why i took this course! But i do regret taking it as an elective!!!!

Nothing in this course was structured, felt harder than Econ 201 as the prof was all over the place. Don't recommend this as an elective as you will regret it. His mid term focused on the irrelevant material and overlooked the main picture!!!!!!

Absolute waste of my 3 hours weekly and time wasted studying on this non structured course. Absolute waste of my money and this prof has no structure for econ 102. I advise you to take a different elective. This course has about 60 - 70 slides per lecture that are all over the place. I have done upper division course econ courses and this is harder

Absolutely horrendous. He was rude answering some questions students had in lecture. Rambles on and on about topics that are simple but when it comes to larger more important topics he bypasses them quickly. Midterm 35% final 50% and they are HARD! Questions are very different every time he teaches the course so the previous exams given are useless

Midterm 35%, and final 50%. Study everything, even the small concepts. Especially, know the concepts from his lecture slides for the exams. Schmitt isn't really approachable. I went to him for help for the final because I was confused and he just sent me away saying whatever I talked about in class will probably be on the exam which didn't help.

Nice guy and know his stuff, I didn't mind his lectures although he did jump around a bit. His absolute downfall is his exam structure. If you forget or didn't study one single term you could fail the whole test. Most profs who have so few questions at least chose interpretive concepts or give prompts beforehand. Study every tiny irrelevant detail.

He posts sample exams from previous semesters but questions are not the same. I noticed his exams from previous semester were much more easier so he makes it difficult. On the exam there was like 4 or 5 questions on only one concept, so go through all the lecture notes. Grading system is not good. Online TopHat participation was a bit helpful.

Econ 102-The world Economy is one of the easiest class offered at SFU, but this prog made this class so boaring. all the slides contain economic data from before 2005. charts were old. don't take this class with him, u will not learn anything.
Why does he teach if he hates students so much?  Gives a bad impression of the Econ department.
boring and mean. Acts like a "know it all"

Regardless of what you've been told this is NOT an automatic GPA booster class. Dr Harris is very dull and doesn't seem interested in the course. His mid term and final are too hard for a 100 level. The only positive is that he puts all of his notes online.
Very interesting material, but he doesn't teach it with much enthusiasm...  Sexy for his age group. (look at his pic on the Department website)... Memorize your notes.
His lectures are extremely boring.  However, the course is interesting and easy itself.  Just study the notes and read the book.  You'll end up doing well.
look up the word boring in the dicitonary and you might find his name.
Easy econ course becuz its 100 level. Alot easier compare to Econ 103/105. Mostly interesting concepts and not boring concepts like 103/105. Just read/memerize all notes for sure will get at least B.
His course material is very easy. IF u study and memorize the lecture notes u will be fine. TAs are cool too and easy markers but they gotta learn how to speak some english.

The lecture topics are very interesting! I like how he structured the course. A bit of each of economic history, globalization and current world issues. You can find some spelling and grammar mistakes in his notes. But that is tolerable. Overall, he is a good prof who knows his stuff...
Really good professor.  Interesting and intellectual lectures
